minidraw.framework
Interface DrawingView

All Superinterfaces:
DrawingChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardDrawingView, StdViewWithBackground
public interface DrawingView
extends DrawingChangeListener

The graphical output medium of MiniDraw, representing the View element of the MVC pattern. Responsibilities: A) To draw all contents of its associated Drawing (model). B) To draw additional graphics such as background and overlay. Author Henrik Bærbak Christensen 2006

Method Summary

          check if any damage has been made to this view and repaint if this is the case.

drawingInvalidated, drawingRequestUpdate
 

Method Detail

checkDamage

void checkDamage()
check if any damage has been made to this view and repaint if this is the case.

drawAll

void drawAll(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the contents of the drawing view. The view has three layers: background, drawing, handles. The layers are drawn in back to front order.

drawDrawing

void drawDrawing(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the complete drawing.

drawBackground

void drawBackground(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the background.

drawSelectionHighlight

void drawSelectionHighlight(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the selection. If figures are selected then they are shown using the associated SelectionHighlightStrategy.

drawOverlay

void drawOverlay(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the overlay. This grapics is overlayed all other graphics: graphics, figures, etc. It is meant to provide boarders etc that may partially overwrite the underlying figures. If you use a fill area image, it must use a transparent color in order for background graphics to appear.

getGraphics

java.awt.Graphics getGraphics()
Get the graphics context of this view
